intro: Heracleum wenchuanense, commonly known as the Wenchuan giant cowparsnip, is a member of the Apiaceae family, characterized by its tall stature and large, umbrella-like inflorescence. Native to China, particularly in the Sichuan province, this plant thrives in moist, temperate environments. It features hollow, ribbed stems and broad, pinnately lobed leaves that can reach several feet in length. The flowers are small and greenish-white, arranged in a compound umbel, typical of the carrot family. Due to its size and ecological significance, it plays an important role in local biodiversity and habitat structure.
